Everything should be working as expected now.

If there's anything else I can help with, always happy to support!

Oh I get what you mean. I have just gone through and checked all the "special interest" fields and removed any data that we no longer want. So you can now update the logic to show the section automatically whenever that field has text - like the Bio (About) field.

Hi Hannah,

Yes - we can definitely add an “About” heading for the Bio section so it displays nicely. Apologies for the earlier mix-up regarding the visibility!

Regarding the Special Interests details: You are correct. Currently, that section is configured to only display for the specific list of doctors you provided earlier. This was to prevent it from showing up on other profiles that have old or incomplete data in that field.

Since Dr De Hoog wasn't on that original list, his section is currently hidden by default.

How would you like to handle this?
  1. Keep the restriction (Safer): I can simply add Dr De Hoog to the allowed list. This ensures no unfinished data appears on other profiles.
  2. Show for all: I can update the logic to show the section automatically whenever that field has text. However, please note this will make it visible on those other profiles that already have data filled in.

Let me know your preference! In the meantime, would you like me to go ahead and add the “About” heading?

Hi Adriane,

I actually just created a page for Dr Richard Lewandowski and pasted some info in his "Bio" box and it is showing on the site - although with no heading. Can we have the heading listed as "About"?

I did noticed, like you have said in your email would happen with the Bio data - the special interest details I pasted into the special interest box for Dr Jonathan De Hoog are not showing. Do you need to switch them on individually?

Thanks!

  • Set it up now - Tell me where you’d like the Bio to appear (like the Special Interests section), and I can configure it so anything you add will display automatically.
  • Wait until all bios are ready - Once you’ve added all of them, let me know where to display the section and I’ll set them all up at once.

Either way works - happy to help get this set up however you prefer!

Hi Hannah,

Thanks for confirming that items 1 and 2 are working as expected - really glad to hear it!

Profile Corrections:
  • Prof. William Coman: We’ve added the missing specialty.
  • Amber Vonhoff: The AMA5 and PIRS tags have been removed.

New Feature - Special Interests Section:
Yes, we can definitely add the "Special Interests" section below the photo and above the "Roles" as you requested. Since you’ve already provided the text for the doctors, do we have your go-ahead to go ahead and develop this section?

Admin Access:
For future tweaks like the profile edits above, you can also make changes directly in the system. If you like, we can set up access for hannah.neri@themisml.com.au.
With access, you can simply head to Team Members in the dashboard and update doctor info anytime - super handy for quick edits.

Let us know if you’d like us to proceed with the new section.

Hi Adriane,

Thanks for the fix on item 1! That is great.

On the item 2, yes this is exactly what I asked to be done. I don't them mixed. I want to keep the first filter as location. Then the second filter as specialty. Both of these unchanged. Then the third filter (assessment type) should only reference the tags/badges and not the specialties at all.

It looks like this has actually already been done on the live site - so thank you for that!

Two other items while I am on the site I just noticed:


  • Professor William Coman's specialty is missing from his profile - can this be updated please? It should be: Ear, Nose and Throat Surgeon (Otolaryngology, Head and Neck Surgery)

  • Amber Vonhoff - could we have the AMA5 and PIRS tags removed from her profile? Sorry this was my error for listing them in the spreadsheet.



New item:
We have had some feedback from clients already which has prompted us to come up with the idea to add an extra section to some expert profiles.

Below their photo, and above "Roles" can we add a new section called "Special Interests" with the following info under the new heading for these experts only:


  • Dr Alice Chang: Dr Chang will assess Child, Adolescent and Adult non-abuse cases.

  • Dr Mark Dekkers: Dr Dekkers will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He specialises clinically in the treatment of knee and hip injuries, especially sports knee surgery and knee & hip arthroplasty.

  • Dr James Fardoulys: Dr Fardoulys will assess all general orthopaedic injuries, with a background specialising in shoulder and knee arthroscopic surgery and sports injuries.

  • Dr Peter Hewitt: Dr Hewitt will assess all general orthopaedic injuries.

  • Dr Owen Jenkins: Dr Jenkins will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has sub-specialty training in foot and ankle surgery and special interests in general trauma, primary and revision joint replacement surgery of the knee and hip, lower limb arthroscopy and foot and ankle surgery.

  • Dr Milos Kolarik: Dr Kolarik will assess all general orthopaedic injuries.

  • Dr Andrew McLean: Dr McLean will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has sub-specialty training in hip and knee surgery.

  • Dr Robert McNinch: Dr McNinch will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has sub-specialty training and special interest in upper limb (elbow, wrist, hand & shoulder) surgery, as well as sub-specialty training in knee surgery.

  • Assoc. Prof. Gary Nielsen: Assoc. Prof. Gary Nielsen will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has sub-specialty training in hip and knee arthroplasty.

  • Dr George Parker: Dr Parker will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has special interest in surgery of the knee and hip.

  • Dr Jeffery Peereboom: Dr Peereboom will assess foot and ankle injuries only. He has sub-specialty training in foot and ankle surgery.

  • Dr Matt Rau: Dr Rau will assess all general orthopaedic injuries. He has special interest in upper limb and knee, joint replacements, arthroscopic surgery, sports injuries and robotic surgery.

  • Dr Mark Shaw: Dr Shaw will assess all general orthopaedic injuries.

  • Dr Seung-Min Youn: Dr Youn will assess upper limb and cervical injuries only. He has sub-specialty training in Shoulder, Elbow and Trauma surgery.



Can you let me know if that will be possible?

Also, is there a way that I can tweak things myself?

Thanks!

(Time: 15mins) Glen modify

Hi Hannah,

I hope you are having a good week.

I have an update from our development team regarding the Booking Forms and a recommendation regarding the Filter Logic for the Experts page.

1. Booking Form for Non-Calendar Experts (Updated) We have updated the submission form logic. It will now auto-populate the specific Expert's name when a user attempts to book and is uneditable by the user. This ensures the email notification you receive clearly states which doctor the inquiry is for.

2. Expert Page Filter Logic Regarding the request to map the "Assessment Type" filter to the "Tags/Badges" column:
Our team reviewed the data and noticed that mixing Tags (e.g., AMA5, GEPI) with Specialties/Roles (e.g., Orthopaedic Surgeon) inside a single filter might make the search experience confusing for users, as these are two distinct types of data.

Recommendation: To improve usability, we recommend keeping these as two separate filters:
  • Filter 1 (Specialty): Filters by Role/Title (e.g., Psychiatrist, Spine Surgeon).
  • Filter 2 (Assessment Type): Filters strictly by Tags/Badges (e.g., AMA5, GEPI).

This would allow users to be more specific (e.g., finding a Psychiatrist who specifically handles AMA5).

Would you prefer we proceed with this two-filter approach, or would you still prefer we merge all options into one single list?

Let us know your preference, and we will finalize the setup!

Hi Hannah,

Thanks for reaching out and following up on these.

Apologies for the delayed response! I hope you’re having a great rest of your day.

We’ve noted these two items regarding the "Assessment Type" filter mapping and the expert identification on the submission forms. We will look into both of these for you and get back to you with an update.

If there's anything else we can help in the meantime, always happy to help!

action.text: Adriane Roa moved this conversation from the Wolf IQ Projects inbox

full_threads.body:
Hi Adriane,

Just following up on some other points in my below email - copied into this email:

Additionally, the filters on the expert page are still not quite right. The "Assessment Type" filter should list all the options from the "Tags/Badges" column of the spreadsheet.

To clarify this one, the "assessment type" filter on the experts page is currently listing the specialties rather than the tags:


Lastly, for any experts who do not have embedded calendars, is it possible for the submission form to indicate which doctor the user has tried to book with? We got our first submission yesterday for a non-calendar expert and this is all we could see:


It would be great if it could specify which expert they were after?

Would you be able to look into these two items for me?

(Time: 20mins)
-Glen

1. Expert Verification
I have confirmed that both Dr. Coman and Dr. Peereboom are already in the system. You can view their profiles here:
  • Dr. Peereboom: [Link]
  • Dr. Coman: [Link]

2. Filter Logic Regarding the 'Assessment Type' filter: There was a request to populate this with 'Roles/Titles' instead of 'Tags/Badges'. However, previously there was also a request to use 'Specialty' for this same filter.
Since we are mixing different data types (Tags, Roles, and Specialties), can we check if the client would prefer a new, additional filter instead? Recommendation: It would be much better for usability if we kept 'Roles/Titles' and 'Assessment Type' as two separate filters.

3. Booking Form I am currently working on this and will provide an update soon.

@adriane

-Glen
